_prev_prog_3.Description:
Reddy Ice-Plant City, located in Plant City, Florida, has developed a combined Process Safety Management/Risk Management (PSM/RMP) Program to address the accident prevention program requirements of both the OSHA and EPA regulations. When implemented, a PSM/RMP Program makes operations safe and accident prevention systematic throughout a facility. The PSM/RMP Program contains fourteen elements, tied together by a management system to ensure development, implementation, and integration of the program requirements. These fourteen elements consist of the following:  Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Pre-Startup Safety Review Program, Standard Operating Procedures, Training, Management of Change, Mechanical Integrity, Hot Work Permits, Contractor Qualifications, Incident Investigation, Compliance Audits, Emergency Planning and Response, and Trade Secrets. To ensure emergency preparedness, Reddy Ice-Plant City has developed a comprehensive Emergency Action Plan (EAP) that includes procedures for proper authority notifications and safe evacuation of facility personnel in the event of an emergency.



As a company, Reddy Ice is committed to operating safe and compliant facilities for the protection of their employees, the public, and the environment. The Plant City facility has multiple safeguards pertinent to the closed-circuit ammonia refrigeration system. These safeguards include mechanical ventilation systems, operating limit controls, and remote system shutdown capability if required. In addition, refrigerant leak detection units are installed throughout the facility to monitor atmospheric concentrations continuously and to notify employees in the event of a fugitive release.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Reddy Ice-Plant City facility, located at 604 N. Frontage Rd., Plant City, FL, operates a closed-circuit mechanical refrigerating system that utilizes anhydrous ammonia (ammonia) as a refrigerant in the manufacture and storage of packaged ice for wholesale and retail distribution. Ammonia, when properly used, has proven to be a safe, reliable, and efficient refrigerant. Due to a moderate toxicity and slight flammability, ammonia is considered a highly hazard chemical.



RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM

As a company, Reddy Ice is committed to operating safe and regulatory compliant facilities for the protection of its employees, the public, and the environment. Incidents involving ammonia can be reduced through properly implementing employee training, establishing a knowledge base of the equipment, and developing effective operating and maintenance procedures for all ammonia equipment. To reduce the risk of ammonia incidents, Reddy Ice-Plant City has developed a combined Process Safety Management/Risk Management (PSM/RMP) Program to meet the requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration and the Environmental Protection Agency regulations defined in 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.



When implemented, a PSM/RMP Program makes operations safe and accident prevention systematic throughout a facility. The PSM/RMP Program contains fourteen elements, tied together by a management system to ensure development, implementation, and integration of the program requirements. These fourteen elements consist of the following:  Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Pre-Startup Safety Review Program, Standard Operating Procedures, Training, Management of Change, Mechanical Integrity, Hot Work Permits, Contractor Qualifications, Incident Investigation, Compliance Audits, Emergency Planning and Response, and Trade Secrets.



MANAGEMENT SYSTEM

A site-specific management system has been developed to oversee the implementation

of the PSM/RMP Program elements for Reddy Ice-Plant City. The Plant Manager has the overall responsibility for ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of the site-specific program requirements. Under the PSM/RMP Program, various responsibilities have been assigned to other individuals as applicable to their role in system operation. 



HAZARD ASSESSMENT

Reddy Ice-Plant City has conducted a hazard assessment, including site-specific offsite consequence analyses (OCAs) for potential accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. The OCAs describe the potential offsite exposure to surrounding areas from an accidental release. A worst-case and alternative-case release scenarios were developed and calculated using the EPA RMP*Comp modeling program. RMP*Comp provided the basis for determining the potentially affected offsite population under each release scenario. 



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

The Reddy Ice-Plant City facility has not had any ammonia releases that would require reporting as part of a five-year accident history.



EMERGENCY PLANNING AND RESPONSE

Reddy Ice has developed a comprehensive Emergency Action Plan (EAP), which includes procedures for emergency notifications, employee training, and safe evacuation of facility personnel. The site-specific EAP is regularly reviewed for verification of data, and revised and updated as necessary to reflect changes in facility operations and personnel.



The Plant City facility has coordinated emergency response activities with local emergency responders and has the appropriate mechanisms in place to notify emergency responders in the event of an emergency. The facility's operating ammonia inventory is verified and reported annually to the state and local authorities, and the facility is incorporated into the community emergency response plan developed under 42 USC.



PLANNED CHANGES



The Reddy Ice-Plant City facility is a modern closed-circuit ammonia mechanical refrigerating system constructed i

n 2007 and installed to local building standards, industry mechanical codes, and recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices (RAGAGEP). Reddy Ice-Plant City was designed with multiple safeguards applicable to the ammonia refrigeration system, including mechanical ventilation systems, operating limit controls, and remote system shutdown capability if required. In addition, refrigerant leak detection units are installed throughout the facility to monitor atmospheric concentrations continuously and to notify employees in the event of a fugitive release. 



At the time of resubmission, no significant changes are planned for Reddy Ice-Plant City's closed-circuit ammonia refrigeration system. However, Reddy Ice operates an ongoing program of preventive maintenance and continuous improvement to identify and implement changes that may result in improved safety and operations.
